conclusion: Determine the current I of the constant current source
Magnetic force on the mover is given by F_B = nBIl
Analyze the motion from t1 to t3
Magnetic force F_B is given by F_B = nBIl
Retarding force F is given as F = (800 - 10v) N
Use the v-t diagram to find the current I
Velocity decreases from v1 = 80 m/s to 0 m/s under retarding force
At t1, retarding force F = 0 N, indicating magnetic force must be balanced
Use conservation of energy or impulse-momentum theorem
Impulse of magnetic force equals change in momentum of mover
Set up equation for magnetic force: nBl * I * t3 = 1/2 * M * v1^2
Solve for current I using equation: I = 32000 / (10 * t3)
Current I is found to be 16 A
